page.syntax: V UI_SHAPE_OVAL(C shape,N x,N y,N width,N height[,C shape_operation])

argument.name: shape
argument.description: The name of a new or existing shape.

argument.name: x
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval. Larger values move right.

argument.name: y
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the upper left corner of the oval. Larger values move down.

argument.name: shape_operation
argument.description: Shape_Operation Optional. Default = erase previous shape. An indication of how to combine the shape with other shapes.

item.name: "and" = show only the intersection of the oval and any other shapes.
"or" = show both the union of the oval and any other shapes.
"xor" = show both the oval and any other shapes, but do not show their intersection.

page.description: Create/modify a named shape with an oval.
page.discussion: UI_SHAPE_OVAL() creates an oval shape in memory that may be combined with other shapes. Limitations: This function is only used in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().

section.example: ui_bitmap_load("stone", file.to_blob("C:\WINDOWS\Greenstone.bmp")) ui_bitmap_create("test", 4, 2) ui_shape_oval("oval", 0, 0, 4, 2) ui_bitmap_draw("test", <<%code% inner_rect(0, 0, 4, 2) clip_shape("oval", 0, 0) bitmap("stone", 0, 0, 4, 2) %code%) ui_dlg_box("", "{image=test}")
